description: {"blocks":[{"key":"mbkn","text":"This SARS-CoV-2 targeted, and rapid viral RNA library preparation and sequencing kit provides an approximately five hour turn-around time from viral RNA sample to sequencing.The kit includes cDNA synthesis, enrichment, and library amplification and indexing.The enhanced protocol removes the need for normalization and quantification prior to amplification and indexing.RNA input is 5 ul, regardless of SC2 viral load in the sample extract.Amplification is performed using two primer pools that produces amplicons that are 300 bp in size, so no fragmentation is necessary prior to sequencing on Illumina platforms.10 bp unique dual indices are provided in the kit, and with a cycle read length of 149 for each paired-end read, the sequencing time is just over 28 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: QIASeq Direct SARS COV-2, Miseq, SARSCOV-2 Enrichment
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"9fv5i","text":"Enhanced QIAseq DIRECT SARS-CoV-2 Kit- with index kit A through H- 96 reaction kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dllr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74fju","text":"Catalog no.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9r3g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co6p4","text":"A (333891), B (333892),","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kd10","text":"C (333893), D (333894),","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e93mu","text":"E (333886), F (333887),","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b20qi","text":"G (333888), H (333889)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"277o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eb8c7","text":"You would need only one index kit with the QIAseq kit. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"af9t6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1eo5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55kuv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":52,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"cce2h","text":"Use 5 μl viral RNA input, regardless of viral titer.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fhsnl","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":39,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8ustp","text":" Set up cDNA synthesis reaction on ice.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fn7rs","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":40,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8vs4p","text":" Use a thermal cycler with a heated lid.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16pho","text":"Thaw template RNA on ice. Gently yet thoroughly mix, then briefly centrifuge to collect residual liquid from the sides of the tubes and return to ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnmbf","text":"Thaw RP Primer (random hexamer), Multimodal RT Buffer, and nuclease-free water at room temperature (15–25°C).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmd92","text":"Mix thoroughly and then briefly centrifuge to collect residual liquid from the sides of the tubes. Prolonged storage of Multimodal RT Buffer at -20°C can cause white precipitate to form. This is normal. Just ensure to mix until precipitate is fully dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qfej","text":"Thaw RNase Inhibitor and EZ Reverse Transcriptase on ice. Mix by flicking the tubes, briefly centrifuge, and return to ice. After use, immediately return the enzymes to the freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvpnq","text":"While keeping reagents on ice, prepare the cDNA reaction according to the table below.  For multiple reactions, prepare the calculated volume for all reactions, plus 10% ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66ip2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1am9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Components","Volume/reaction(ul)"],"colWidths":["187","187"],"data":[["EZ Reverse Transcriptase","1"],["Multimodal RT Buffer, 5x","4"],["Nuclease-free water","8"],["RNase Inhibitor","1"],["RP Primer","1"],["Template RNA","5"],["Total volume","20"]],"guid":"6D1348707E4B11ECB987E7A279A4AF84","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["EZ Reverse Transcriptase","1"],["Multimodal RT Buffer, 5x","4"],["Nuclease-free water","8"],["RNase Inhibitor","1"],["RP Primer","1"],["Template RNA","5"],["Total volume","20"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddp2u","text":"Proceed to“ SARS-CoV-2 Enrichment Procedure”. Alternatively, the samples can be stored at−30 to–15°C in a constant-temperature freeze.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cve6","text":" While keeping reagents on ice, set up Pool 1 and Pool 2 reactions for each sample, as described below","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5hcu","text":" Component Pool 1: Volume/reaction (µl) Pool 2: Volume/reaction (µl) cDNA from “Protocol: Enhanced QIAseq DIRECT” 8 8 DIRECT SARS-CoV-2 Pool 1 2 --- DIRECT SARS-CoV-2 Pool 2 --- 2 UPCR Buffer, 5x 5 5 QN Taq Polymerase 1 1 Nuclease-free water 9 9 Total volume 25 25 ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":401}],"data":{}},{"key":"e63ek","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","6_2":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","7_2":""},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":["194","132","145"],"data":[[" Component "," Pool 1: Volume/reaction (µl) "," Pool 2: Volume/reaction (µl) "],[" cDNA from “Protocol: Enhanced QIAseq DIRECT” "," 8 "," 8 "],[" DIRECT SARS-CoV-2 Pool 1 "," 2 "," --- "],[" DIRECT SARS-CoV-2 Pool 2 "," --- "," 2 "],[" UPCR Buffer, 5x "," 5 "," 5 "],[" QN Taq Polymerase "," 1 "," 1 "],[" Nuclease-free water "," 9 "," 9 "],[" Total volume "," 25 "," 25 "]],"guid":"D4670F107FE311EC859B0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[[" Component "," Pool 1: Volume/reaction (µl) "," Pool 2: Volume/reaction (µl) "],[" cDNA from “Protocol: Enhanced QIAseq DIRECT” "," 8 "," 8 "],[" DIRECT SARS-CoV-2 Pool 1 "," 2 "," --- "],[" DIRECT SARS-CoV-2 Pool 2 "," --- "," 2 "],[" UPCR Buffer, 5x "," 5 "," 5 "],[" QN Taq Polymerase "," 1 "," 1 "],[" Nuclease-free water "," 9 "," 9 "],[" Total volume "," 25 "," 25 "]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1duo7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdh8m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8uhuj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n7m5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":256,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a22tj","text":"For samples with a broad/unknown range of Ct values (i.e.,above and below Ct=32) incubate as described in the below table 12.1. For samples with Ct \u003e 32, also incubate as described in step 12.1 For samples with Ct value \u003c 32, incubate as described in 12.2.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4a4dg","text":"After amplification, combine the entire contents of “Pool1” and “Pool2” PCR reactions for each biological sample into a single well of a plate, giving a volume of 50µl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nr6d","text":"Add 50µl QIAseq Beads to each 50µl combined sample. Briefly centrifuge ,“gently yet thoroughly” vortex to mix, and centrifuge briefly again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63dte","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2erq4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f89uu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":120,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"b1sg4","text":"Vortex the QIAseq Beads thoroughly to ensure they are well resuspended; the solution should be a homogenous brown color.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"32vil","text":"Incubate for 5min at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4sana","text":"Centrifuge the plate until the beads are pelleted(2min), and then place the plate onto a magnetic rack. After the solution has cleared(2min or longer), carefully remove and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqo1h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftbs0","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3bj4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"51AFACF080BB11EC9189EF0635D2AF99","height":149,"id":204482,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":27,"offset":41,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2u68h","text":"A- Top left: After pooling PCR rxns, add 50ul room temp QIAseqbeads to each 50ul rxn and perform bead clean up","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6me0h","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c692n","text":"B: Top right: Example of beads beginning to pellet. NOTE: At this point, ~2 min should do it.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6d6ec","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":25,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9qpkg","text":"D. Fully pelleted beads. NOTE: Solution is completely clear.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dqu12","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghyebns2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghycbns2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghydbns2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghybbns2x.webp","width":550}}}}

To prevent cross-contamination, each well is single use.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ffsd","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":28,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"54vda","text":"Set up the reactions on ice.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2o6la","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":39,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"6v1cu","text":"Use a thermal cycler with a heated lid.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ml48","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":85,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"elqj","text":"Equilibrate the QIAseq Beads to room temperature (15–25°C) for 20–30 min before use. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7f2f4","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":180,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"3gmbp","text":"Vortex the QIAseq Beads thoroughly to ensure they are well resuspended; the solution should be a homogenous brown color. If a delay in the protocol occurs, simply vortex the beads.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"djthn","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":44,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"1n92p","text":" Important: Prepare fresh 80% ethanol daily.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19kjk","text":"Prepare the reagents required for library amplification and indexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ra1v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9adcv","text":"Thaw the QIAseq DIRECT UDI Index Set A, B, C, or D, as well as the UPCR Buffer, 5x, at room temperature. “Gently yet thoroughly” vortex to mix, and then centrifuge briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqsbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhtiv","text":"Thaw the QN Taq Polymerase. Mix by flicking the tubes, and then centrifuge briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"th7n","text":"On ice, prepare the library amplification and indexing reaction according to Table in Step 31. Briefly centrifuge, “gently yet thoroughly” vortex to mix, and centrifuge briefly again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h9ah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"baavi","text":"Note: If setting up more than one reaction, prepare a volume of master mix 10% greater than what is required for the total number of reactions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1u0mu","text":" Reaction mix for library amplification and indexing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b356m","text":"        Component  Volume/reaction    “Enriched   SARS-CoV-2” sample  24 μl    Index from   QIAseq DIRECT UDI index plate (A, B, C, or D) Plate  2 μl    Nuclease-free   water  12 μl    UPCR Buffer 5x  10 μl    QN Taq   Polymerase  2 μl    Total reaction   volume  50 μl  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":271}],"data":{}},{"key":"7qacg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["332","121"],"data":[["Component","Volume/reaction"],["“Enriched

{"blocks":[{"key":"d22jv","text":"Transfer the plate to the thermal cycler and start the program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31c9h","text":"Once PCR is complete, add 40 μl of resuspended QIAseq Beads to each 50 μl reaction. Briefly centrifuge, “gently yet thoroughly” vortex to mix, and centrifuge briefly again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k67s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8lqn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cn80d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":120,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"j1a8","text":"Vortex the QIAseq Beads thoroughly to ensure they are well resuspended; the solution should be a homogenous brown color.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fke62","text":"Incubate the mixture for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1il4","text":"Centrifuge the plate until the beads are pelleted (2 min), and then place the plate onto a magnetic rack. After the solution has cleared (2 min or longer), carefully remove and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3sog","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3j1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":72,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5bp05","text":"Important: Do not discard the beads as they contain the DNA of interest.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9efj7","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":102,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8bdi6","text":"Tip: It may be valuable to discard the supernatant twice. The contents settle after the first discard.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnl9g","text":"With the plate still on the magnetic stand, add 200 μl of 80% ethanol. Wait 1 min and carefully remove and discard the wash. Repeat the wash, for a total of 2 ethanol washes. Remove excess ethanol as much as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfbdu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a89tu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":298,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"135l3","text":"Important: To completely remove all traces of the ethanol wash after the second wash, immediately briefly centrifuge and return the plate to the magnetic stand. Remove the ethanol with a 200 μl pipette first, and then use a 10 μl pipette to remove any residual ethanol. This should be done quickly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45l30","text":"With the plate still on the magnetic stand, air-dry at room temperature for 4–8 min (until the beads start to crack and pellet loses its shine).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"303a3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l35u","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bo9v7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"6366D2A080BD11EC9189EF0635D2AF99","height":305,"id":204486,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":84,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"blssd","text":"Air dry the beads until ALL EtOH is removed and the beads appear cracked (see image)","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ful9m","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":153,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7940d","text":"To check  pellets, turn tube around and look at pellet from back. Holding tubes in front of a sheet of white paper increases ability to visualize cracks.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghyibns2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghygbns2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghyhbns2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghyfbns2x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fic4t","text":"Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and elute the DNA from the beads by adding 25 μl nuclease-free water. Vigorously vortex (triturate if necessary) to mix, briefly centrifuge, and incubate for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6pscd","text":"Centrifuge the plate until the beads are pelleted (2 min), and then return the plate to the magnetic rack until the solution has cleared (2 min or longer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8j6uu","text":"Transfer 23 μl to a clean plate. This is the “SARS-CoV-2 library”. If not proceeding immediately, the sample can be stored at –30 to –15°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ane03","text":"Assess the quality of the library using a Bioanalyzer, TapeStation (D1000 tape), or Fragment Analyzer. Check for the expected size distribution of library fragments. An example library is shown here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bmtu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqvap","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dtm8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"983BC8D080BA11EC9189EF0635D2AF99","height":247,"id":204490,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghynbns2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghykbns2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghymbns2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghyjbns2x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dcg13","text":"Using the attached Post library worksheet, calculate the nM based on the Qubit concentration (ng/ul) and the Tape station (bp) profile. Normalize the “SARS-CoV-2 library”, to 4nM. Quantify the final pool at the end. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83ncq","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1to72","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"7E30A300821A11ECAFBACD6CFAE20D9F","id":204325,"original_name":"Postlibraryworksheet.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghtfbns2x.xlsx"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qups","text":" Proceed to loading on to MiSeq (150x 150 cycle) using the attached Sample Sheet. Alternatively, the purified “SARS-CoV-2 library” can be safely stored at –30 to –15°C in a constant-temperature freezer until ready to use for sequencing.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":236,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c1bav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"59B9A7F0821B11ECAFBACD6CFAE20D9F","id":204327,"original_name":"SampleSheet.csv","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghthbns2x.csv"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ajtq","text":"Proceed to “Library Amplification and Indexing Procedure”. Alternatively, the samples can be stored at –30 to –15°C in a constant-temperature freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bnnp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lmhi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1fe4r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":138,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"e4qeq","text":"We are adding tails ONLY to SARS-CoV-2 sequence, and that will keep all the contaminants at bay when you perform your final amplification.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ei3ms","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":161,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"1jt2s","text":"So, after  you transferred the 28ul of supernatant from your elution, this is a good time to get a feel for what you have if you want to do a mid-protocol check.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b4nup","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":123,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4c2nm","text":"Use a high sensitivity Qubit (for example) and check the concentration of the enrichment      reactions after bead cleanup.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5nl29","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":174,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"b61rl","text":"With wastewater samples anything that is 1ng/ul and above (even down to 0.5ng/ul with high      Ct values) is a success and should definitely  move on to final amplification!","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f1kgr","text":"Transfer 28 μl to a clean plate. This is now “enriched SARS-CoV-2”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2a1ar","text":"Centrifuge the plate until the beads are pelleted (2 min), and then return the plate to the magnetic rack until the solution has cleared.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"742te","text":"Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and elute the DNA from the beads by adding 30 μl nuclease-free water. “Gently yet thoroughly” vortex (triturate if necessary) to mix, briefly centrifuge, incubate for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2e1g0","text":"With the plate still on the magnetic stand, air-dry at room temperature for 4–8 min (until the beads start to crack and pellet loses its shine).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aomuj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33rif","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"39jb1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"A41C98E080BB11EC9189EF0635D2AF99","height":305,"id":204494,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":84,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"1k68a","text":"Air dry the beads until ALL EtOH is removed and the beads appear cracked (see image)","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ev0v","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":153,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"e0lio","text":"To check  pellets, turn tube around and look at pellet from back. Holding tubes in front of a sheet of white paper increases ability to visualize cracks.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghysbns2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghyqbns2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghyrbns2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghypbns2x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d21do","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7il3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9hl7i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":299,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"3nps4","text":"Important: To, completely remove all traces of the ethanol wash after the second wash, immediately briefly centrifuge and return the tubes to the magnetic stand. Remove the ethanol with a 200 μl pipette first, and then use a 10 μl pipette to remove any residual ethanol. This should be done quickly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3oi1","text":"With the plate still on the magnetic stand, add 200µl of 80% ethanol. Wait 1min and carefully remove and discard the wash. Repeat the wash, for a total of 2 ethanol washes. Remove excess ethanol as much as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80sbp","text":"Important: Do not discard the beads, as they contain the DNA of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd97l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44sth","text":"Tip: It may be valuable to discard the supernatant twice. The contents settle after the first discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
